item.description: 1 Differential Forms Before introducing the concept of curl, we need to first introduce differential forms and the exterior derivative. An n-form can be defined as an alternating multilinear mapping $\omega:(T_p^*M)^n\rightarrow \mathbb{R}$. It maps multiple vectors to a real number. Additionally, it satisfies the alternating property, meaning that exchanging two input vectors results in an output multiplied by a negative sign.
